meanings.definition: To make a dull, explosive sound.
meanings.sent1: The old car engine would chug along the road.
meanings.sent2: The train started to chug slowly out of the station.
meanings.sent3: The chugging noise of the washing machine made the house feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The distant chugging of the boat echoed through the misty morning.
meanings.sent5: The chugging of the steam engine filled the air with nostalgia.

meanings.definition: To drink something quickly and noisily.
meanings.sent1: He would chug his water after a long run.
meanings.sent2: The students would chug their sodas at the party.
meanings.sent3: She chugged her milkshake so fast, she got brain freeze.
meanings.sent4: The workers would chug their coffee to stay awake during the night shift.
meanings.sent5: The athletes chugged their energy drinks before the race.

meanings.sent1: The chug of the old tractor could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: The sudden chug of the generator startled the campers.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmic chug of the train put him to sleep on the journey.
meanings.sent4: The constant chug of the waterfall created a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected chug of the fireworks made everyone jump.
